result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Tussey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment is for unpaid restitution as ordered by the Court and allowed by the Judgment of Conviction.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution and court costs due by payment plan of a minimum of $100 a month beginning 10/30/15.

Attorney fees ($1079) are due payable to Clerk of Courts office by continued payment plan of $75 a month beginning 10/30/15. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed and you will still owe the balance.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No contact with victims D.N.; H.K. or Prostar Surfaces

May petition for early release from probation if deemed appropriate by agent and upon full payment of restitution.
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Michael E Tussey in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of penalties and finds probable cause.
